Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Are you sure you would like to invest all memory data from the stack?'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Timestamps implemented. Returning to data structure...'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Now... show me what you will do this time.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory524.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Liv... is still out cold.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Bedridden, Liv is quietly sticking through her suffering exactly as you remember.'}
{3: 'At the same time, feeling the pain from recovery that you did back then at this point in time, you remember what had happened.'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Don't think anyone would have complained if this weren't part of the replay...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Guess the mechanoid does it to ensure the accuracy of the simulation.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Historically speaking, Liv was exactly right here bedridden at Star of Life at this point in time from switching back to her Eclipse frame.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Holding the side rail of Liv's bed, Lee sounds calm."}
{3: "Try to mask himself as he may, you see right through Lee—and the emotional turmoil that's now raging in him."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: '...And I ran into Chiko, too.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'At the mention of the name, the room falls silent.'}
{3: 'They all know what the name means.'}
{3: 'Because everyone in the room—including Liv who\'s bedridden "at this moment"—has experienced the battle at the beach.'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'I asked Commander Nikola to refrain from sending Chiko to Earth.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'And as of now, Commander Nikola has yet to reject my request.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Silence once again befalls the room.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "This is a virtual space, Bianca, and nothing we do here is going to change what's already happened.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "But I... just can't help it.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Bianca shakes her head with a wry smile.'}
{3: "Lee is right. We're just living through a replay here, and it's fundamentally different from traveling back in time."}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'So Chiko might just be upset...', 3: '43'}
{2: "If you do what you're trying to do.", 3: '44'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: "Right. Knowing her, I'm sure she would.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "But I'm going to do it anyway, even if it's my decision isn't going to change what's already happened.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'What did you and Chiko usually do, then?', 3: '49'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Well, we were "usually" either on missions or out fighting.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "That's what we did most of the time, and we never really had the time to hang out.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'You can probably try hanging out with Chiko.', 3: '52'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "And that's all I need to do?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Looking at Bianca, you seem to see in her eyes a billion things she can\'t put into words—some about the past, and some about the "future."'}
{3: "Finding yourselves where the past and future cross paths, you can't help but wonder if there is more you can do."}
{3: "This, perhaps, is probably why Lee has asked Nikola—the actual Nikola who's come to this virtual world, too—to put the team on standby at Babylonia."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "None of us was by Liv's side in the past when she was suffering.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Lee and I had ourselves repaired and tested after the battle, and then we were out on missions again with some of the other teams.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Based on previous infiltration, we can do whatever we want to do, as long as what we do is, historically speaking, factually correct.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "And historically speaking, I couldn't use my Hyperreal Frame just yet because I was in the process of adjusting to it at this point in time.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "And Liv is here bedridden because... again, historically speaking, that's what happened.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'This replay is based on "events that have a significant impact on history," which means those events already pre-exist in the first place.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: "And that means we're able to make our own decisions on events that are not these pre-existing events.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lee nods in silence.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: "We can't change the past, Bianca.", 3: '77'}
{2: 'But we still have a chance to cherish what we once forgot.', 3: '78'}
{2: 'I understand that this is a far cry from "making up" for what\'s imperfect...', 3: '79'}
{2: 'But you can still do what you would have hoped to do.', 3: '80'}
{3: 'Casting one last look at Liv, Bianca nods and quietly leaves the room.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory14.png'}
{3: "Like Task Force, Purifying Force can be found on standby in the lounge when they're off duty."}
{3: 'As always, Chiko is on standby in the lounge waiting for her next assignment.'}
{3: 'But we still have a chance to cherish what we once forgot.'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Wanna catch a movie?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Putting down the report she's been reading, Chiko looks dubiously at Bianca."}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'What gives?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "That's what we do sometimes, right? And we're both off duty today.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "Sure... Anything you're in the mood for?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Let's go down to WGAA and check out some of the new movies they're playing now.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Fixing her eyes on Bianca, Chiko wants to find out what's going on."}
{3: "Sensing nothing else from Bianca's genuine invitation, Chiko gives in."}
{3: 'Chiko lets out a sigh and breaks into a smile.'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "Sure. Let's go, then.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory262.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Seems like we only ever walk down this way when we go to the movies together.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "True. I mean, we're always out there on missions and all.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Remember that time when you wanted to watch a movie but the ticket ended up in your battle report and got submitted to Headquarters?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "It was a physical ticket that was hard to come by. You didn't say a thing, but I could tell how upset you were.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: '...I remember now.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "The ticket was for a night screening of Sunset Street. It was a slice-of-life kind of movie, and that's what I found interesting about it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: '...I wonder what umeshu tastes like.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Sweet and sour, no?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Have you tried it?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Nope, but they probably have an electrolyte that tastes like that here in Babylonia.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "Let's go and give it a try sometime, then.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Since you asked me to go to the movies with you.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "...Thought you'd hate the idea of a quiet life.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "I wouldn't say I hate it, but a quiet life is just something I can never see myself living.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "Some people lived in big houses by the beach back in the Golden Age, but that's not something I've ever thought about.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Away from the crowd and leaning against the railings, Bianca and Chiko are taking their time to enjoy the afternoon sun.'}
{3: "Or, more accurately, the artificial sun hanging in Eden's artificial sky."}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Have you been to the aquarium by any chance?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "They have a super long glass tunnel, and you can see all sorts of sea creatures swimming on the other side of... Hey, what's wrong?", 4: '2'}
{3: "Noticing the look on Bianca's face, Chiko stops talking and looks her way."}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "That's what came to my mind when I thought about the movie.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'My baby sister said she wanted to see whales and sea urchins.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: 'Whales and... sea urchins?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "They're completely different in size, though.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "I don't know why she named those two, but it was already too late and I just stopped thinking about it.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Well... I'm sure that day will come.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Sure, I guess.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'With it, they both fall silent again.'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'I had a look at the brochure for the investigation assignment that you called off, and the locale was the aquarium.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Why, though?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "If I had to make a choice again, Chiko, I'd still stop you from going on that mission.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Chiko says no more as she looks Bianca quietly in the eye.'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'You... sound like you know what would have happened.', 4: '2'}
{3: "The look on Chiko's face remains unchanged, but Bianca picks up a familiar yet rare tenderness in her tone."}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "...I do, and I also know that there's no stopping you from accepting the mission.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: '"I can hold death up to ridicule if I can criticize darkness."', 4: '2'}
{3: "In place of her response, Chiko reads out a line from the movie's promotional poster."}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "You're exactly as I remember you.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Gazing up at the artificial sky, Bianca, for the first time, catches undisguised grief in her own voice.'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'And you... are no longer the Bianca I know?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: "Which is why... I'm still going to accept the mission, Bianca, because I know I'll have you by my side.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'In the artificial sun, Chiko smiles a rare but genuine smile.'}
{3: 'I can hold death up to ridicule if I can criticize darkness.'}
{3: 'I can bid farewell to dawn if I can do the same to darkness.'}
{3: 'I shall rise in hope if I shall succumb to darkness.'}
{2: 'Chiko', 3: 'Shall we?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The screen over at the turnstile shows the title of the movie they came to watch. Letting go of the railings, Chiko gestures for Bianca to follow her.'}
{3: 'And just like old times, Chiko is the one taking the lead.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{2: '??', 3: "Let's go back to the fourth iteration in a bit and give it another shot from a different angle."}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory586.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory586.jpg'}
{3: "Rubbing her eye at the desk, Karenina stares at the electronic wall before her—that's overflowing with calculations."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'What in the world is this...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Teddy', 3: "I see you're awake. You're now officially a piece of garbage.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Right back at you. I just woke up from a power nap and am still trying to figure out what happened.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Oh boy, finally lost it from all the overtime work, huh? Wait, you were never quite right in the head to begin with.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Deciding that the argument is going nowhere, Karenina turns around to look at the clock...'}
{3: 'Six hours have passed since the mechanoid—who called itself "Conductor"—brought them into this replay.'}
{3: 'According to Conductor, time in this virtual space works differently than it does in the real world—a dozen days in here are roughly half a day out there.'}
{3: 'Still, Karenina finds six hours unbearably long.'}
{3: 'Unlike everyone else, Karenina was brought to the lunar base by the train—which Conductor simply wrote off as, "The train went just a little too far."'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Researcher', 3: 'Sir, the guys from Babylonia are here.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'With panda eyes, Yarha looks up from mountains of data.'}
{2: 'Yarha', 3: "Again? Didn't they just send people down here last week?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Researcher', 3: 'They came with supplies and a table of construction-related materials for infrastructure, apparently.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Yarha looks quizzically at Teddy and Karenina.'}
{3: "From an engineering perspective, he knows that he would do well to trust them with this kind of logistics deployment, given that they're from the Cosmos Technicians Union."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Not going to have a look?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Wait, me? And I guess I should just file a complaint to the Union against you while I'm at it?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Excuse me?', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Let\'s see what I\'m going to put down in my letter of complaint... "Mishandling of Level-Three radioactive substances" or "excessively high deterioration rate of experiment consumables"...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "And that's all you have stored up in there, huh?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Look at you working up that little brain of yours for this argument.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yarha', 3: 'Uhm... fancy a piece, Teddy?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "...I'm pretty sure Yarha is just saying it so you wouldn't beat the hell out of him.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yarha', 3: "No, I'm just... You see, I'm sure you're tired from work, so why don't we...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Chop chop and get it done already.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "I don't think we're done with iteration for this time, no? There's new data and a structure experiment waiting to be verified, no?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "I'll get all those done to make up for the time I was out cold napping, yeah?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Boy, never thought I'd ever hear that from you...", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yarha', 3: 'Haha... Well, shall we? See, I can really use some stretching here... Uhm, was that my spine that just cracked?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Yes, yes it was.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Pushing both Yarha and Teddy out of the lab, Karenina once again lies face down on the experiment table with a frown.'}
{3: "Historically, at this point in time, zero-point energy's engine had yet to work, and the moon was still safe."}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Hmph, history can't be changed, huh? Just watch me do that in this virtual space...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Researcher', 3: "Ma'am, about the data from just now...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Alright, just leave it here and I'll go through it in a bit. Go on and try to catch up to Yarha already.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Researcher', 3: 'Certainly.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'After the researchers leave, Karenina picks up her Blast Hammer by the door and steps out of the lab.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory585.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory585.jpg'}
{3: "She knows the way from the lab to the control room for zero-point energy's engine like the back of her hand."}
{3: 'It all began with the engine—and destroying it would nip it all in the bud.'}
{3: "She did it once—and no matter how many times she has to do it again and what it's going to cost her, Karenina believes she'll always get it right."}
{3: "In the past—the one she actually lived through in the real world—she faced the seemingly impossible and prepared for failure. Given another chance, however, she'd do the same nonetheless."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: "Come what may—because real or not, I'm not backing away!", 4: '1'}
